recipes.title: Dandelion Wine
recipes.description: Traditional dandelion flower wine requiring 6-12 months aging

instructions.text: Pick fresh flowers, trim stalks, remove all green parts if possible
Place flowers in large bowl; set aside 1 pint of water
Bring remaining gallon to boil; pour over flowers
Cover tightly with plastic wrap; leave 2 days, stirring twice daily
Transfer flowers and water to large pot; bring to low boil
Add sugar and thinly peeled citrus (avoiding white pith)
Maintain low boil for 1 hour; pour into fermenter
Add citrus juice and pulp; allow cooling
Add yeast and yeast nutrient; cover and place in warm location for 3 days
Strain into secondary fermenter
Add raisins and fit fermentation lock
Strain and rack after wine clears, topping with water
Leave until fermentation stops completely; rack again
Wait 2 months, then rack and bottle
Age 6 months to 1 year before consuming

notes: Use only yellow petals, remove all green parts
Traditional wine requiring patience for best results

recipes.title: Dandelion Burgers
recipes.description: Vegetarian patties made from dandelion petals

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together (batter will be goopy)
Form into patties
Pan fry in oil or butter, turning until crisp on both sides

notes: No, they don't taste like hamburger, but they ain't bad

recipes.title: Dandelion Blossom Bread
recipes.description: Quick bread made with dandelion blossoms and honey

ingredients.prep_note: all green sepals and leaves removed

instructions.text: Combine dry ingredients in large bowl, including petals (separate clumps)
In separate bowl mix milk, honey, oil, and beaten egg
Add liquid to dry mix (batter should be fairly wet and lumpy)
Pour into buttered bread tin or muffin tin
Bake muffins at 400°F for 20-25 minutes, or bread for up to twice as long
Test for doneness before removing

recipes.title: Dandelion Blossom Syrup
recipes.description: Honey-like syrup made from dandelion flowers, used as base for many other recipes

instructions.text: Put blossoms and water in pot
Bring just to boil, turn off heat, cover, and let sit overnight
Next day, strain and press liquid from spent flowers
Add sugar and sliced citrus
Heat slowly, stirring occasionally, for several hours until reduced to thick, honey-like syrup
Can in half-pint or 1-pint jars

notes: Citrus is optional; omit for pure dandelion flavor
Recipes typically triple or quadruple this
Used as base ingredient for many other dandelion recipes

recipes.title: Kudzu Blossom Jelly
recipes.description: Delicate jelly made from kudzu flowers

instructions.text: Wash blossoms with cold water and place in a large bowl
Pour 4 cups boiling water over blossoms and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight
Pour blossoms and liquid through colander into Dutch oven, discarding blossoms
Add lemon juice and pectin; bring to full rolling boil over high heat, stirring constantly
Stir in sugar and return to full rolling boil
Boil while stirring constantly for 1 minute
Remove from heat and skim off foam
Pour into hot sterilized jars, filling to 1/4 inch from top
Wipe jar rims, cover with metal lids, and screw on bands
Process in boiling water bath for 5 minutes
Cool on wire racks

recipes.title: Beautyberry Jelly
recipes.description: Beautiful red/pink jelly made from wild beautyberries

ingredients.prep_note: washed and cleaned of green stems and leaves

instructions.text: Combine 1½ quarts cleaned beautyberries with 2 quarts water
Boil for 20 minutes
Strain to create infusion
Measure 3 cups of the infusion and bring to a boil
Add 1 envelope Sure-Jell and stir well
Add 4½ cups sugar
Bring to a second boil and boil for 2 minutes
Remove from heat and let stand until foam forms
Skim off foam
Pour into sterilized jars and cap

notes: Yields a soft-set jelly with a beautiful red/pink color
Some makers have found they need double the Sure-Jell pectin for proper gelling
Berries must be fully ripe (magenta colored) for best results

recipes.title: Loquat Wine
recipes.description: Homemade wine from fresh loquats

instructions.text: Remove seeds and chop fruit finely
Pour fruit over half the sugar, crushed tablet, tannin, nutrient, and water in primary vessel
Cover with cloth. After 12 hours, add pectic enzyme
After another 12 hours, add yeast
Stir daily, adding remaining sugar after 3 days
Ferment on pulp 4 more days with daily stirring
Strain through jelly bag. Pour remaining sugar into juice and transfer to secondary with airlock
Rack after 30 days; repeat every 30 days until clear (3-4 additional times)
Rack once more and taste. Add stabilizer and sweeten if needed with up to 1/4 cup dissolved sugar
Bottle and store in dark place for 1 year

notes: Tastes similar to a dry semi-sweet sherry

recipes.title: Loquat Pie
recipes.description: Double crust pie with loquat filling, seeds taste like nuts when baked

ingredients.prep_note: stemmed, washed, cut up, leaving a few seeds for flavor

instructions.text: Stem, wash, and cut up loquats, leaving a few seeds for flavor
Cook loquats in water covered for about 10 minutes until almost tender
Combine sugar, flour, salt, ginger, and allspice
Stir into loquats. Cook stirring until thickened
Remove from heat and cool
Pour into pie plate with bottom crust
Cover with top crust, prick with fork or make steam vents
Bake at 450°F for 10 minutes, then reduce to 350°F for 45 more minutes

notes: When the pie is baked, the seeds taste almost like nuts
Serve with vanilla bean ice cream and light rum sauce

recipes.title: Persimmon Bread
recipes.description: Rich quick bread made with persimmon puree, nuts, and dried fruit

ingredients.prep_note: melted and cooled to room temperature

instructions.text: Butter 2 loaf pans; line bottoms with parchment paper or dust with flour
Preheat oven to 350°F
Sift the first 5 dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl
Make a well in center; stir in butter, eggs, liquor, persimmon puree, nuts and raisins
Bake 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean

notes: Optional: Orange zest or orange extract can be added

recipes.title: Violet Jelly
recipes.description: Delicate jelly made from violet flowers that turns pink when lemon is added

instructions.text: Place violet blossoms in a glass jar and cover with boiling water
Cover the jar with a lid and let steep for 2-24 hours until water turns aqua blue
Strain and discard spent flowers
Add lemon juice; mixture will turn pink
Stir in pectin and bring to a boil
Add sugar and return to boil
Boil vigorously for one minute
Skim if necessary
Pour into sterile jars and seal

notes: The color transformation from blue to pink when adding lemon is magical

recipes.title: Elderberry Wine
recipes.description: Traditional homemade wine from ripe elderberries

instructions.text: Wash elderberries and remove stems, discarding unsuitable ones
Boil water and dissolve sugar
Place berries in nylon straining bag, tie, and position in primary container
Mash berries wearing sterilized gloves
Pour hot sugar water over berries and cover
When cooled to lukewarm, add acid blend, crushed Campden tablet, and yeast nutrient
Cover and wait 12 hours
Stir in pectin enzyme, cover, wait 12 hours
Add yeast. Stir daily for 14 days
Gently squeeze bag (sterile gloves) daily, recovering container
Drain without squeezing after 14 days, add juice to primary container
Rack into secondary container with airlock
Store in dark place, ferment 2 months
Rack again, top up, refit airlock
Repeat racking process two more times
Stabilize and wait 10 days
Rack again, sweeten to taste
Bottle and store in dark place for 1 year

notes: Proper preparation is essential - unprepared purple elderberries can cause illness

recipes.title: Gorse Wine
recipes.description: Floral wine made from gorse flowers

instructions.text: Place flowers in a fermenting bucket immediately
Boil half the water with half the sugar and chopped raisins for 1-2 minutes, then pour over flowers
Thinly peel oranges and lemons, add to bucket along with squeezed juice
Include tea or tannin and stir thoroughly
Fill to 1 gallon with cold water
When tepid, add yeast and nutrient, stir well and cover
Ferment for 1 week, stirring daily
After 2-3 days, when fermenting well, add remaining sugar and dissolve
Strain through sieve or cloth and siphon into gallon jug
Fill to neck with cool boiled water
Rack when clear, bottle and age for six months

recipes.title: Pindo Palm Wine
recipes.description: Wine made from pindo palm fruit

ingredients.prep_note: dissolved in 1 liter boiling water, cooled

instructions.text: Cover fruit with water and rub out seeds using clean hands
Mash fibrous fruit pulp
Add crushed Campden tablet; let sit covered for 24 hours
Prepare wine starter
Add pectinase dissolved in water; wait several hours
Add sugar syrup, tannic acid, and yeast nutrient; make up to 5 liters total
Add yeast
Stir 3 times daily for 6 days
Sieve into demijohn
Rack and add sugar as needed
Target final specific gravity of 1.020

recipes.title: Pindo Palm Jelly
recipes.description: Jelly from pindo palm fruit, also known as jelly palm

ingredients.prep_note: follow Sure Jell box recipe for 3 cups juice

instructions.text: Cut and scrape fruit from seeds (yield approximately 3 cups cleaned fruit)
Cover fruit with 3 cups water
Bring to boil; cook until approximately 3.5 cups infused juice remains
Filter juice (optional; filtering affects clarity)
Follow Sure Jell box instructions for 3 cups juice
Add 2-3 cups sugar depending on taste preference

notes: Called the jelly palm because the fruits, in a good year, have enough natural pectin to make jelly, barely
Additional pectin recommended for reliable results

recipes.title: Kudzu Flower Wine
recipes.description: Wine made from kudzu blossoms

instructions.text: Pick blossoms when dry (mid-day)
Wash in pan of water containing 1/2 cup vinegar to kill bugs
Pour 2.5 quarts boiling water over blossoms and stir
Cover and stir twice daily for four days
Strain liquid through clean cloth, pressing blossoms to extract all liquid
Add 4 cups sugar
Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water
Pour dissolved yeast into liquid and stir well
Transfer to one-gallon jug
Add water to bring liquid within 2 inches below neck
Attach balloon and secure with twine or rubber band
Place jug in cool dark place between 60-75°F
Every other day, loosen balloon to release gas, then replace firmly
In approximately 6 weeks, when balloon stops expanding, wine is done
Strain through clean cloth into airtight bottles
Allow to sit 2-12 months before drinking

recipes.title: Cranberry Sauce
recipes.description: Simple whole cranberry sauce

instructions.text: Wash berries
Add sugar, stir thoroughly
Cook slowly without additional water (just what is on the berries from washing)
Boil 10 minutes

recipes.title: Cranberry Bread
recipes.description: Quick bread with cranberries and orange

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, soda and salt
Combine orange juice, grated rind, melted shortening and enough water to make 3/4 cup, then stir in beaten egg
Pour mixture into dry ingredients, mixing just to dampen
Spoon layer of batter into greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan, spreading evenly
Sprinkle cranberries over layer, add more batter, sprinkle with berries, then repeat until all used
Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 50 to 60 minutes
Remove from pan and cool
Store overnight for easy slicing

recipes.title: Cranberry Muffins
recipes.description: Whole wheat oat muffins with cranberries

instructions.text: Combine milk and oats
Mix egg, oil, and sugar
Mix dry ingredients
Add berries to dry ingredients till coated
Mix all ingredients just till blended
Bake at 350°F for 18-20 minutes

recipes.title: Cranberry Pie
recipes.description: Chiffon-style cranberry pie with whipped cream topping

instructions.text: Cook berry sauce and cornstarch until thickened. Cool and keep for top
Cook sugar and 1/3 cup water to soft ball stage (238°F)
Add gelatin softened in 1/4 cup water
Slowly pour syrup over stiffly beaten egg whites, beating constantly
Add salt, lemon juice and almond extract, continue to beat until cool
Beat cream and combine with egg white mixture
Pour into pie shell
Chill until set
Spread cranberry sauce over top and place in fridge until serving time

recipes.title: Cranberry Salsa
recipes.description: Fresh cranberry salsa with cilantro and jalapeño

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in food processor fitted with medium blade
Chop to medium consistency
Refrigerate if not using immediately
Serve at room temperature

recipes.title: Mulberry Pie
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (via Marian Van Atta)
recipes.description: Fresh mulberry pie with cornstarch thickening

instructions.text: Add sugar to mulberries in a saucepan
Mix cornstarch with water
Add cornstarch mixture to berries
Add juice
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and juice becomes clear
Pour into baked pie shell
Cool and serve

recipes.title: Mulberry Vinegar
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (via Marian Van Atta)
recipes.description: Fruit vinegar made from mulberries, used as a refreshing drink

instructions.text: Place 3 quarts clean mulberries in a large bowl
Mash and pour 3 cups of boiling-hot white vinegar over berries
Cover with a towel and for 3 days, mix fruit with a wood spoon
Strain juice through jelly bag
To each cup juice add one cup sugar
Boil together for 5 minutes
Pour into sterilized jars and seal

notes: To use: pour 2 tablespoons mulberry vinegar in an 8 ounce glass, fill with water and ice

recipes.title: Mulberry Sauce
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (via Marian Van Atta)
recipes.description: Spiced mulberry sauce for meats or desserts

instructions.text: Add spices to mashed berries
Bring to boil
Simmer until thick stirring often
Bottle and seal

recipes.title: Maypop Jelly
recipes.description: Jelly made from wild passionflower fruit

instructions.text: Combine the maypops and water, then simmer gently for five minutes
Strain the mixture, discarding the pulp
Combine the resulting liquid with sugar and bring to a full rolling boil
Add pectin and return to a rolling boil
Remove from heat and pour into hot, sterilized jars, then seal

notes: Maypops are wild passionflower fruit

recipes.title: Hawthorn Jelly
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (Euell Gibbons recipe)
recipes.description: Traditional jelly from hawthorn berries

instructions.text: Crush three pounds of fruit
Add four cups water
Bring to boil, cover, simmer 10 minutes
Strain juice through jelly bag
Discard pulp, seeds, and skins
Add pectin if berries are very ripe
Add lemon juice if desired
Put 4 cups juice in large saucepan, bring to boil
Add 7 cups sugar
Return to boil and test for jelly consistency

recipes.title: Hawthorn Schnapps
recipes.description: Infused spirit made from hawthorn berries

ingredients.prep_note: stalkless, from Crataegus monogyna or laevigata
clear, unflavored, enough to cover berries

instructions.text: Rinse berries and allow to dry
Fill 2/3 of a clean glass jar with berries
Cover completely with vodka
Seal with tight-fitting lid
Steep for 5-6 weeks in dark place at 64-68°F
Shake lightly from time to time
Strain and filter into clean bottle
Age for a couple months in dark place before serving

recipes.title: Nettle Pesto
recipes.description: Pesto made from blanched stinging nettles

ingredients.prep_note: blanched in boiling water for 1 minute, drained and roughly chopped

instructions.text: Blanch nettles in boiling water for 1 minute, drain and roughly chop
Place the blanched nettle, pine nuts, Parmesan, salt, and pepper in a food processor
Blend until smooth, or reduce by hand
While processing (or mixing manually), gradually pour in the olive oil until well distributed

notes: Wear gloves when handling raw nettles
The cooking water from blanching can be reserved for nettle tea or used as a soup base

recipes.title: Cactus Flower Wine
recipes.description: Wine made from prickly pear cactus flowers

instructions.text: Wash flowers; place in nylon straining bag with dozen marbles for weight
Heat 1 quart water and dissolve sugar
Cool with frozen grape juice concentrate and remaining water; add to primary
Add remaining ingredients except yeast; stir well
Cover and wait 10-12 hours before adding activated yeast
Stir daily until specific gravity drops to 1.020
Transfer to secondary; attach airlock
Rack after 45 days, then again after another 45 days (topping up each time)
Rack again 60 days after wine clears
Age bulk 90-120 days; stabilize, sweeten to taste, bottle
Taste after 6 months in bottle

notes: Pollen continues settling for 1-2 months

recipes.title: Cactus Jelly
recipes.description: Jelly made from prickly pear cactus fruit

instructions.text: Place fruit in large saucepan; cover with boiling water and let stand 2-3 minutes
Drain water and peel fruit; cut into pieces
Cover with water and boil at high heat for 5 minutes
Strain through cheesecloth; discard seeds
Combine juice, sugar, and lemon juice in large saucepan
Bring to rolling boil; add pectin
Cook 8-12 minutes until thickened; skim foam
Pour into sterilized jars; process in boiling water bath for five minutes

recipes.title: Grilled Cactus Pads
recipes.description: Simple grilled nopales

instructions.text: Scrub cactus pads well, remove any spines
Cut around the spiny nodules and remove completely (optional for young thin pads)
Grill over charcoal for 10-12 minutes per side (thicker pads take longer)
Brush occasionally with oil while cooking
Serve hot

notes: Young thin pads can be grilled whole without spine removal

recipes.title: Cactus Monterey
recipes.description: Sautéed cactus with tomato, onion, and cheese

instructions.text: Steam cactus until softened; drain
Lightly fry remaining ingredients except cheese
Combine fried ingredients with cactus
Simmer 15 minutes
Top with cheese before serving

recipes.title: Nasturtium Bouquet Salad
recipes.description: Mixed greens salad with nasturtium flowers

ingredients.item: white wine vinegar or champagne vinegar

instructions.text: Whisk together all dressing components in a bowl
Just before serving, toss greens, chives, and flowers with sufficient dressing to coat

recipes.title: Nasturtium Bundles
recipes.description: Cream cheese stuffed nasturtium leaves

ingredients.prep_note: washed, dried and chopped (thyme, lemon verbena, basil, chives, or rose petals)

instructions.text: Blend cream cheese, pineapple, and selected herbs
Generously spread mixture onto each nasturtium leaf
Roll up and arrange on serving platter
Garnish with nasturtium flowers

recipes.title: Persimmon Pudding
recipes.description: Baked persimmon pudding with walnuts

instructions.text: Stir condensed milk, sugar, butter, flour, and persimmon puree well
Pour into glass baking dish
Sprinkle chopped walnuts on top
Bake 35 to 45 minutes at 375°F
Serve warm or at room temperature

notes: Optional topping of crème Anglaise or rum

recipes.title: Acorn Bread
recipes.description: Quick bread made with acorn flour

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients
Bake in a pan at 400°F for approximately 30 minutes until done

notes: This bread spread is also a great way to preserve acorns and can be used for cookies
Acorn flour when baked is crumbly like cake

recipes.title: Amaranth Tabouli
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (via Salt Spring Seeds)
recipes.description: Middle Eastern salad made with amaranth instead of bulgur

instructions.text: Simmer amaranth in an equal volume of water for 12-15 minutes
Allow to cool
Place all ingredients except lettuce and olives in a mixing bowl and toss together lightly
Chill for an hour or more to allow flavors to blend
Wash and dry lettuce leaves and use them to line a salad bowl
Put the amaranth mixture on the lettuce and garnish with olives

recipes.title: Garlic Mustard Vichysoisse
recipes.description: Cold soup featuring garlic mustard and goat cheese

instructions.text: In a heavy bottomed pan, add water and potatoes with salt, then boil until potatoes soften. Set aside
Melt butter in a saucepan, add chopped onion and cook until softened. Pour over boiled potatoes and water
Blend in food processor until smooth. Add water as needed for consistency and pass through a sieve
Chill in refrigerator and check seasoning
Blanch garlic mustard for 10 seconds in salted boiling water and refresh in ice water
Add garlic mustard and blend until smooth
Add three cornered garlic and blend until smooth, checking seasoning again
Serve with crumbled goat cheese, frothed milk, cumin pinch, and white pepper

recipes.title: Pasta con Finocchietto Selvatico e Salsiccia
recipes.attribution: Green Deane, Eat The Weeds (via Rosetta Constino)
recipes.description: Penne with wild fennel and Italian sausage

ingredients.prep_note: leaves and slim, tender stems only (115 grams)

instructions.text: Wash fennel fronds thoroughly in hot water to remove insects
Boil 5 quarts of water in an 8-quart pot over high heat. Add fronds and boil for 10 minutes
Remove fronds with a colander, reserving the cooking water for pasta. Drain fennel well and finely mince to yield 1/2 to 2/3 cup
Remove sausage from casing and break into small clumps
Heat olive oil in a 10-inch skillet over moderately high heat. Add sausage, cooking until no longer pink and lightly browned, stirring constantly and breaking into smaller pieces
Add minced fennel greens, stir well to coat with oil, and season with salt. Keep warm over reduced heat
Add 1/4 cup salt to reserved fennel water and return to boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water and drain
Return drained pasta to skillet with sausage and fennel. Cook over moderate heat for 1-2 minutes, moistening with reserved pasta water
Serve immediately

recipes.title: Dandelion and Burdock Beer
recipes.description: Traditional British soft drink made from dandelion and burdock roots

instructions.text: Place nettles, dandelion leaves, burdock, ginger, and thinly pared lemon rinds in large pan with water
Bring to boil and simmer 30 minutes
Pour lemon juice, 1 lb sugar, and cream of tartar into container; strain liquid through, pressing ingredients
Stir to dissolve sugar
Cool to room temperature
Sprinkle in yeast
Cover and ferment in warm place for 3 days
Pour off and bottle, adding 1/2 tsp sugar per pint
Leave undisturbed until clear (about 1 week)

recipes.title: Onion Soup On The Trail
recipes.description: Wild onion soup with cattail and Jerusalem artichoke

instructions.text: Chop onions and boil in 1/4 cup water for five minutes
Add remaining liquid along with cattail and Jerusalem artichoke
Cook at low temperature without boiling
When artichoke is nearly done, add flour and chia seeds, then mix
Season to taste

notes: Great for camping and trail cooking

recipes.title: Homemade Vinegar
recipes.description: Guide to creating your own vinegar mother and making vinegar

ingredients.prep_note: flat beer, wine, or cider without preservatives

instructions.text: Create mother trap: Hang a 1-2 liter plastic soda bottle in a shaded location
Combine sugar, water, banana peel, and optional vinegar
Leave uncovered or cover loosely with cheesecloth
Between 2-6 weeks, you should see phlegm-like cloudiness in the liquid - this is your mother
Pour your alcohol base (flat beer, wine, or cider) into a container with the mother
Cover with cheesecloth and store in a warm, dark location
It takes about 3 months to get a real good zip to the vinegar
Bottle and either add sulfites, heat to 140-160°F, or refrigerate

notes: Preserve mothers between batches by refrigerating them in a little beer
Neither base nor container can have any preservatives or be treated to get rid of bacteria
